newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile's CMPC Q1 net slides - VP Matte.
newsitem.headline: Chile's CMPC Q1 net slides - VP Matte.

text.p: Chilean paper-maker Empresas CMPC expects its first quarter net earnings to be 40 percent lower than in the same period 1996, said vice president Eliodoro Matte.
"The first quarter has not been a good quarter. There has been an important fall of a little more than 40 percent compared with the first quarter last year," Matte told reporters.
The company's earnings were hurt "very badly" by the revaluation of the peso against the dollar, he said.
CMPC reported net profits of 42.7 billion pesos last year, sharply lower than its 83.7 billion peso net in 1995.
The company, Chile's largest paper maker, is investing $560 million in upgrading its operations in coming years, he said.

"We are carrying out a vast investment plan which means a complete productive restructuring of our installations which means in 1997 and 1998, as in 1996, we will be bringing on line instalations for more than $500 million," he said.
